value.title: Mia Dand’s Fight For Inclusion In The Endeavor To Save Humanity From The Dark Side Of AI
value.excerpt: Unapologetic. Unwavering. Determined. Mia Dand created 100 Brilliant Women in AI Ethics and spearheaded and cultivated a strong community, which brought out necessary change in the midst of pervasive AI.

value.title: Google says it’s going to sell ethics advice to AI companies
value.excerpt: Google‘s working on a service that would provide ethics consulting for companies building AI solutions. According to a report from Wired, the company is considering launching this ethics consultancy service by the end of the year.

value.title: Google Offers to Help Others With the Tricky Ethics of AI
value.excerpt: After learning its own ethics lessons the hard way, the tech giant will offer services like spotting racial bias or developing guidelines around AI projects.

value.title: Are Robots Eating Our Jobs? Not According To AI
value.excerpt: AI is replacing jobs while creating new ones and new job roles — profound benefits to the global economy await their arrival.

value.title: Professor Alena Buyx on the embedded ethics approach in AI development
value.excerpt: The increasing use of AI (artificial intelligence) in the development of new medical technologies demands greater attention to ethical aspects. An interdisciplinary team at the Technical University of Munich (TUM) advocates the integration of ethics from the very beginning of the development process of new technologies.

value.title: Bipartisan Policy Center And Ethics Policy For Artificial Intelligence: Inside The Beltway Thinking Is Still An Issue
value.excerpt: I am rarely impressed by Inside the Beltway thinking. My recent reading of “Turning Point” is an exception that proves the rule. For the second time this month, I came upon a discussion of governmental policy for AI,

value.title: Michael Kanaan: The U.S. needs an AI ‘Sputnik moment’ to compete with China and Russia
value.excerpt: Minus AI,” Kanaan calls attention to the need for the U.S. to wake up to AI as a matter of global power, in the same way that China and Russia have.

value.title: A Dogfight Renews Concerns About AI's Lethal Potential
value.excerpt: Alphabet's DeepMind pioneered reinforcement learning. A California company used it to create an algorithm that defeated an F-16 pilot in a simulation.

value.title: The term ‘ethical AI’ is finally starting to mean something
value.excerpt: By framing ethical problems as narrow issues of fairness and accuracy, companies could equate expanded data collection with investing in “ethical AI.” The efforts of tech companies to champion fairness-related codes illustrate this point: In January 2018,

value.title: AI Weekly: Surveillance, structural racism, and the Biden 2020 presidential campaign
value.excerpt: What Joe Biden and Kamala Harris said about tech at DNC 2020 and a look at the kinds of AI and algorithmic bias mentioned in the Biden 2020 plan.

value.title: Exeter experts organize global AI summit to address ongoing healthcare crisis
value.excerpt: A global summit which aims to boost effective collaboration between experts working in Artificial Intelligence (AI) is being organised by academics at the University of Exeter.

value.title: Smart Dubai’s Artificial Intelligence Ethics Advisory Board Convenes for Its 2nd Meeting for 2020, Explores Next Steps
value.excerpt: The Artificial Intelligence (AI) Ethics Advisory Board – an initiative by the Smart Dubai – has convened for its second meeting for 2020 on Thursday, Au

value.title: MIT SMR: How AI changes the rules: New Imperatives for Intelligent Organization
value.excerpt: Many leaders are excited about AI’s potential to profoundly transform organizations by making them more innovative and productive. But implementing AI will also lead to significant changes in how organizations are managed,

value.title: Multi-AI competing and winning against humans in iterated Rock-Paper-Scissors game

value.title: IBM launches three free AI-focused online learning platforms for young people and their teachers
value.excerpt: Teachers working with younger students in the K-8 range can use IBM's Teacher Advisor with Watson to better plan lessons that meet the individual needs of their students. Rather than teaching particular AI-based skills and information about emerging ...

value.title: Artificial intelligence ethics a 'primary concern' for IBM
value.excerpt: Technology Editor at the Australian David Swan says it is “incredibly important” to address the ethics in artificial intelligence in order to protect the use of Australian data.

value.title: AI readiness isn’t just a technology issue – ethics matter too
value.excerpt: For example, in AI Readiness, Alex Castrrounis explains readiness regarding Technological, Financial and Cultural Issues. Summarizing some of his points: Organizational — Need a Chief AI Officer (CAIO) or chief analytics officer (CAO),

value.title: Artificial Intelligence And Data Privacy – Turning A Risk Into A Benefit
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence applications are not open, and can put privacy at risk. The addition of good tools to address privacy for data being used by AI systems is an important early step in adding trust into the AI equation.

value.title: Stanford Center for Health Education Launches Online Program in Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare to Improve Patient Outcomes
value.excerpt: The Stanford Center for Health Education launched an online program in AI and Healthcare this week. The program aims to advance the delivery

value.title: New funding for racial justice AI and data projects
value.excerpt: The Ada Lovelace Institute’s JUST AI programme has launched a £40,000 fund, supported by the Arts and Humanities Research Council (AHRC), for work addressing racial justice and AI ethics.

value.title: POLITICO AI: Decoded: Ethics at IBM — How AI could help fight the coronavirus — Workforce surveillance
value.excerpt: We zoom in on how employers use controversial AI technology to monitor their employees. And we hear from IBM’s AI ethics chief how her company is trying to live up to the ethics it’s preaching. WORKPLACE SURVEILLANCE: Ever heard of “people analytics”?

value.title: Before we put $100 billion into AI
value.excerpt: America is poised to invest billions of dollars in AI, but this funding could have bad effects if it's not tied to accountability for equal opportunity.

value.title: How The Federal Government’s AI Center Of Excellence Is Impacting Government-Wide Adoption Of AI
value.excerpt: The GSA's AI Center of Excellence aims to improve and enhance AI implementations in the government and help agencies on their journey with AI adoption. The relatively small team at the GSA AI CoE is helping to bring about some very impressive changes within the federal government.

value.title: AI Weekly: Can language models learn morality?
value.excerpt: Researchers believe representations could imbue language models with a broader set of human preferences about the world, and thus morality.

value.title: The Ethics Of Using Chatbots For Legal Services
value.excerpt: Delegating legal work to robots involves several risks, including running afoul of statutes dictating unauthorized practice of law, but with the right precautions, law firms can lawfully employ artificially intelligent chatbots that can imitate human conversations,

value.title: What’s this? A bipartisan plan for AI and national security
value.excerpt: Hurd (R-Tex.) and Kelly (D-Ill.) offered suggestions to prevent the US from falling behind China, especially, on applications of AI to defense and national security. They want to cut off China’s access to AI-specific silicon chips and push Congress and federal agencies to devote more resources to advancing and safely deploying AI technology.

value.title: Researchers examine the ethical implications of AI in surgical settings
value.excerpt: In a whitepaper, researchers at the Vector Institute examine the ethical implications of applying AI and machine learning systems in surgical settings.

value.title: Why Companies Need Their Own AI Code Of Conduct
value.excerpt: If companies are smart, they will craft their AI Principles and Ethics position soon and be ready for the demands the market and their customers will expect from them in the age of AI.

value.title: Organizations successfully scaling their AI initiatives see biggest benefit in growing revenue, ahead of improving operational efficiency
value.excerpt: Organizations successfully scaling their AI initiatives see biggest benefit in growing revenue, ahead of improving operational efficiency By 1 - A new report from the Capgemini Research Institute examines the pace of enterprise Artificial Intelligence (AI) adoption in

value.title: Technologists and business leaders don't see eye to eye on artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: Business leaders and technologists see artificial intelligence differently -- which is not a surprise. However, they have different perspectives on the progress on AI projects, and what it takes to scale AI to meet enterprise challenges. For example ...
